cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles west of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast, likely between southeast Louisiana and the Alabama/Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Grand Isle LA to AL/FL border; Tropical Storm Watch AL/FL border to Ochlockonee River FL; Storm Surge Watch mouth of Mississippi River to AL/FL border including Mobile Bay and Lakes Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida coast (including Tampa Bay), Florida Panhandle, and the north-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (2-4 inches likely with isolated 6 inches along the west coast of Florida)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (forecast 1-3 ft for west-central FL including Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible; sustained gales unlikely (≤10% probability)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1-3 ft above ground possible around Tampa Bay, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Saturday night through Sunday with totals 2-4 in., locally up to 6 in., causing urban/flash flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; low but non-zero tornado threat through Saturday night
